content:
No worries about the misunderstanding! I'm glad I could help with the farm-related questions, though.

Regarding Bessie, now that the broken fence is fixed, you might notice a decrease in her stress levels and anxiety. A secure enclosure can help reduce her stress and make her feel more comfortable. Keep an eye on her appetite and make sure she's getting enough to eat, especially during the winter months when she might need more energy to stay warm.

If you notice any changes in her behavior, such as decreased appetite or lethargy, it's always a good idea to consult with your veterinarian to rule out any underlying health issues.
